section.title: Introduction
section.para: This specification describes the p:validate-with-schematron XProc step. A machine-readable description of these steps may be found in steps.xpl.
Familarity with the general nature of steps is assumed; for background details, see .

section.title: Validate with Schematron
section.para:
The p:validate-with-schematron step applies
processing to the source document.

para.error: It is a dynamic error if the assert-valid option is true and any Schematron assertions fail.

section.para: The value of the phase option identifies the Schematron validation phase with which validation begins.
The parameters option provides name/value pairs which correspond to Schematron external variables.
The result output from this step is a copy of the input.
Schematron assertions and reports, if any, must appear on the report port. The output should be in Schematron Validation Report Language (SVRL).
The output of this step may include PSVI annotations.

section.title: Document properties
section.para: All document properties on the source port are preserved on the result port. No document properties on the schemas port are preserved. No document properties are preserved on the report port.

section.title: Step Errors
section.para: This step can raise dynamic errors.

A A dynamic error is one which occurs while a pipeline is being evaluated. Examples of dynamic errors include references to URIs that cannot be resolved, steps which fail, and pipelines that exhaust the capacity of an implementation (such as memory or disk space).

If a step fails due to a dynamic error, failure propagates upwards until either a p:try is encountered or the entire pipeline fails. In other words, outside of a p:try, step failure causes the entire pipeline to fail.
